channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping on and around field at the end of Medway Road Stoneham Recreation ground, 14th August
item.description:
There is a lot of used toilet paper and kitchen towel spread around the field at the end of Medway Road Crayford and Shearwood Crescent in the dog field. Please can this be removed asap.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair dumped, 14th August
item.description:
A chair has been dumped outside My Mothers house , it has been pushed down the street for days but since Friday 8th has remained there. She cannot remove it herself as she is housebound .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Durrington Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abondon untaxed Vehicle in private Parking lot, 14th August
item.description:
There is an untaxed white van abandoned in our building private parking lot. We have reported it to the police (CAD REF 6490/13AUG25) but were told to contact the council for action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: DANGER!! New traffic island forces vehicles into cyclists, 14th August
item.description:
The new traffic island scheme at the unfinished crossing forces vans, buses, trucks and articulated lorries towards the kerb at a unexpected angle. This immediately means they push cyclists into the pavement or under their wheels. The obvious result is that cyclists are going to be knocked off bikes here and that people will die, if cycle lanes are not clearly marked VERY SOON. Does Westminster City Council really want to be sitting on this time bomb?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7-12, Sloane Square, Chelsea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse dumped outside house, 14th August
item.description:
The garden of this house was cleared of rubbish last week and the rubbish has now been dumped on the pavement where it is being spread everywhere by foxes. It is a disgusting health hazard and not the first time either.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolstone Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council road sweeper urinating in priestfield road, 14th August
item.description:
07.50 thursday 14th august 2025. Now I know it is a bodily function BUT I do not expect to see a Lewisham Council road sweeper urinating against a fence in full view of residents and passers by. A quiet word with the ibdividual concerned to prevent this happening again is called for.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priestfield Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Stolen Scooter, 14th August
item.description:
An abandoned stolen scooter has been left at the corner of Hampden Avenue and Hampden Road. It has no number plates and looks like some of the wiring has been removed. It has been there for over a week now. Please can someone remove it.
